STATE OF CONNECTICUT

General Assembly

Proposed Bill No. 817

January Session, 2025

LCO No. 884

*00884*

Referred to Committee on INSURANCE AND REAL ESTATE

Introduced by:

SEN. LOONEY, 11th Dist.

AN ACT PROHIBITING HEALTH INSURERS FROM USING SOFTWARE TOOLS TO AUTOMATICALLY DOWNCODE HEALTH INSURANCE CLAIMS.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives in General Assembly convened:

That title 38a of the general statutes be amended to prohibit any health insurer from using a software tool, including, but not limited to, artificial intelligence or an algorithm, to automatically downcode or deny a health insurance claim submitted by a health care provider without detailed review by a clinical peer.

Statement of Purpose:

To prohibit any health insurer from using a software tool, including, but not limited to, artificial intelligence or an algorithm, to automatically downcode or deny a health insurance claim submitted by a health care provider without detailed review by a clinical peer.
